blog.title: The Stark Bunch
blog.description: Tony Stark has two sons, Peter and Harley. Peter And Harley have a lot of genius friends that act as more children of his own.

body:
Truth or Dare

Peter: Hey Dad, truth or dare?

Tony: *raising an eyebrow* Truth.

Riri: What’s your credit card number?

Tony: Dare.

Harley: I dare you to give up your credit card number.

The Unwilling Avenger

Chapter Two: Midtown High

           I got up really early Monday to do my hair and makeup. After I had finished, I grabbed my backpack, and left. I had practiced driving to Midtown three times since I had left the football field, but I still put it in my GPS just in case. There was more traffic in the morning, which I had planned for. I arrived about two hours before school officially started, which was my plan. I enter the school building at 6:15. I head for the front office and tell the lady I’m a new student. In forty-five minutes, I’m walking back out with a fresh, official schedule. I still have over an hour before school starts, so I ask for directions to the training room. The lady tells me, and I thank her before trudging my way towards the other end of the school. I find what I’m looking for, the name ‘Sydney Baker, AT’ printed on the door tells me I’ve found the right place. I knock before placing my hand on the door handle.

           “Come in!” I hear, and I push open the door to see the biggest training room I’ve ever been in.

           “Woah.” I say, looking around.

           A tall woman approaches me, with a I-need-more-coffee face on. “Can I help you?” She asks, eyeing me.

           “Hi yes, my name is Raine, I just transferred in this morning and I-“

           She turns, pulling a paper packet off her desk. “Fill these out and have a doctor fill them and sign off and then we can get you playing. What sports do you play?” She asks, sitting down at her desk and booting up her computer.

           “Oh no, you misunderstand. I’m here to see if you need any football trainers,” I shuffle around in my bag until I find the paper I’m looking for, “this is a letter of recommendation from my former head trainer in Tennessee.” She takes the paper from me, reading silently. I look around as she reads, taking in all their equipment. It all looks state of the art, brand-new. I’m focusing in on their ice machine when she clears her throat.

           “You come very highly recommended.” She states, looking over the letter once again. “If you’re as good as they say you are then you can come work for me. We don’t get a lot of kids who come to train so it’d just be me and you.” I nod, grinning.

           “Thank you so much. I love training, it’s my entire life to be honest.” I say, shifting the weight of my backpack.

           “The only requirements are that you have good grades, come to practice twice a week, and of course all games, here and away.” I nod, expecting no less.

           “I’ll be here. Do you need me today?” I ask, eager to get my hands on all the new equipment I’m spying.

           “If you want. Practice starts as soon as the school day is over.” I nod and shake her hand.

           “I’ll be here.” I say, turning to leave.

 

           I get to the front entrance with ten minutes to spare. I see Ned and Peter standing with a tall girl. Ned sees me first, waving. “Hey!” He yells, causing Peter and the girl to turn and wave at me too.

           “Hey!” I say, jogging to close the distance between all of us. “Sorry I’m late. I had somethings to do before school started.”

           “It’s cool. MJ, this is Raine. Raine, MJ.” Ned says, nodding towards the girl.

           She sticks her hand out. “So, you’re the pretty truck girl these guys couldn’t shut up about all weekend. Well they weren’t wrong about you being pretty. I’m MJ.” I take her hand as the boys both protest.

           “Hey!”

           “We did not talk about her all weekend!”

           I laugh at them both while MJ smiles.

           “Oh yeah, you all didn’t tell me about her milk chocolate eyes, perfect teeth, and perfectly curly hair? Did I dream you all telling me that stuff? Because it all seems to be true.” Her eyebrows raise, and I laugh some more.

           “MJ!” Peter groans, and Ned nervously chuckles.

           “Hey, I’m more than okay to hear about her over Liiiiiz, Parker.” MJ teases. This time Ned laughs.

           “Wait who’s Liz?” I ask, looking between them all.

           “No one!” Peter quickly quips up, turning red. “Will you please not say that so loud?” He asks, looking over his shoulders.

           “Liz,” Peter makes shushing noise towards MJ, but she continues, “is the love of Peter’s life. He’s had a crush on her since freshman year, but she’s popular, a senior, and doesn’t know that Peter even exists. So, him and Ned stalk her every chance they get.” MJ dishes, much to Peter’s horror.

           “Ooo well then I feel special if I made such an impression on you two if I trumped Liz.” I say, grinning, Peter smiles at me. MJ asks for my schedule and I hand it over to her, we all start walking in what I guess is the direction of my class.

           “I have second period general physics with you. These two both have advanced physics.” She says jerking her finger towards the boys who have fallen in step behind us. They’re whispering to each other but nod when she mentions them. She stops walking, and we all come to a grinding halt. “This is your class room Raine, Algebra II with Lackluster. I’ll pick you up after and take you to physics.” I nod but the boys both start to kick up a storm.

           “Hey, I can come get her no problem!” Ned says, while Peter nods.

           “You two both have class on the other side of the school. And I have our next class with her, so it makes sense. You two can drool over her later.” MJ replies, and the boys complain again.

           “Thanks guys, but I really don’t need y’all to make an extra trip just for me. I’ll be fine with MJ.” They both look disappointed but agree. We all say our goodbyes as the bell rings. I duck into the class and quickly scan the room. There seems to be two seats left, one in the front where a bunch of the stoners seem to be, and one near the middle where a bunch of popular kids seem to be sitting. I take my chances on the popular kids, taking my seat.

 

           By the time my last three classes roll around I’m already tired. But as soon as I see Peter I perk back up. I see him waiting near the door for my last class, presumably to pick me up. But his eyes seemed trained on something out of my range of vision. I walk towards him looking in the direction he is. I get nearer to him when I see a pretty girl around the corner. She is pulling books out of her locker the front of the locker has magnetic letters that spell ‘Liz’ out on the front. And suddenly, what he’s staring at makes sense. I sneak up by him, whispering “Whatcha looking at Peter?” In his ear, scaring him.

           “Oh! Huh? I wasn’t staring at her-anything! I wasn’t staring at anything!” He says, all jumpy. A soft smile plays on my lips.

           “She really is pretty. Do you talk to her? Like have you tried?” I ask, falling in step with him.

           “Oh no. I think she likes Flash, they’re together a lot.” He says, shrugging. “Besides MJ was over playing it. I didn’t have a huge crush on her.”

           “Did? That’s past tense Pete.” He shrugs, his fingers looped through his backpack straps.

           “She’s pretty, but you know as time goes on, I realize being pretty doesn’t add up to everything. Personality is a lot of it. We’re here.” He says, opening the door for me.

           I nod, following him to his seat. “Here, the seat beside me is free. Ned was originally in here, but he dropped it to take Comp Shop.” Peter pats the seat next to him. I put my backpack on the floor and take my seat. Soon the teacher enters, and my mouth hangs open. I was expecting and older lady, but the woman in front of me can’t possibly be thirty yet, but she is strikingly beautiful.

           “Peter how do you not pay attention to that?” I ask, dumb founded. She flicks her blonde hair over her shoulder writing ‘Mesopotamia’ on the board.

           The boy shrugs his shoulders. “I guess she’s not my type. Besides, every boy in here degrades her and the things they say about her, it’s sick.” I smile at him softly. Almost as if to make his point, she drops her marker. She hasn’t even bent over to pick it up and the boys in the back whoop and holler at the prospect of her having to bend over. She casts an icy gaze on the boys with her blue green eyes, kicks the marker under her desk and then pulls a new one out of her desk. I grin at her antics, knowing full well that she’s doing it on purpose.

           The bell rings, and she begins to take attendance. She gets towards the bottom of her attendance sheet when she pauses. “Elizabeth Workapick?” She calls out scanning the room. The boys in the back all make a fuss over my name. Believe me I’ve heard every play on the name Workapick.

           I stand up, and one of the boys let out a whistle. Peter turns and glares at them. “Hey baby, you come back here, sit with me and I’ll let you work this pick.” They all laugh as he motions to his groin.

           Peter almost comes out of his seat, fuming. I simply roll my eyes. “Sorry man, I don’t they’ve invented enough equipment to find your,” I motion to my groin, “try someone with microscopes for eyes.” The guys friends lose it, yelling out “OH BURN!” “MAN, SHE JUST FLAMED YOU!” among other things. I look down at Peter, who is grinning ear to ear, mouth slightly agape. They guys in the back are still yelling when I turn my attention back to the teacher. “I’m Elizabeth Workapick. But I go by middle name, Raine. I just moved hear from Tennessee.” I say, and she nods, trying not to smile at me. She marks me present, tells the boys to settle down and then begins teaching.

           Soon enough I’m sitting in my last class of the day, junior English. The rest of the class is preparing their final drafts on ‘Of Mice and Men’. I sit in the corner, watching Ned and Peter type their essays, as I’ve been exempt since they’re almost done.

The final bell rings, signaling the end of the day, and I pick my backpack up, shouldering it. We meet up with MJ.

           “Hey guys.” She greets us.

           “Hey MJ.” I say, shuffling through my bag to put my schedule in there.

           “Hey Raine, do you wanna come and play Mario Cart with us at my house? We usually study after words, if Pete doesn’t ditch us.” Ned asks, taking a drink from his water bottle.

           “I wish I could but one; I’ve never played Mario Cart, and two; I have to go to football practice.” I make a face, while everyone stares at me. They continue staring so I start to wipe my face. “What? Do I have something on my face?” I ask, looking at them. But now they’re paying no attention to me, glancing at each other.

           “What do you mean you have football practice? Like you’re going go watch football practice?” MJ asks, cocking her head to the side.

           “No, I, I’m like a football nurse. It’s called football training. I go to practice and games. I’m medical team if they get hurt. And a water girl when they need it.” I explain, but they still look confused. “Okay, if you all want to see what I do you’re welcome to come watch practice or a game sometime. But I gotta go, I don’t wanna be late on my first day.” I say, waving and walking off from them. As I turn away from them, they are still standing there, looking dumbstruck.

 

           An hour later I have three crates made with ice and water, two full sized coolers with ice and water, and one mini with just ice. I load all of that, and the training bag, AED, and helmet bag into the golf cart. I get the keys from Sydney, and drive onto the field. I’ve changed out of my school clothes and into some athletic shorts, and old shirt, a hat with my hair pulled into a ponytail, and tennis shoes. I pull onto the field and start unloading, starting with the big coolers. I flex my muscles a bit as I unload them, setting the first one on the table.

           “Here let me help you with that!” I hear a male voice say from behind me. I turn to see a boy wearing the number 28 jogging towards me, his helmet in his hands. “You new?” He asks, and I nod as he unloads the second big cooler.

           “Yeah I transferred in this morning. I’m a student athletic trainer.” He nods, reaching for the smaller cooler. I watch his bicep ripple, and before I can warn him it’s not as heavy, he uses his full strength to lift it and socks himself in the eye, cooler and all. The cooler crashes to the ground as he grabs his eye.

           “Son of a bitch!” He yells, clutching his left eye. Immediately I go to his side, putting my one of my hands over his, the other on his back.

           “Hey let me see. C’mon quit hopping around like that and let me look.” I say, he stops hopping around, but is still clutching his eye. His right pierces me.

           “A warning would’ve been nice man.” I chuckle, tapping his hands still covering his eye.

           “If you hadn’t been flexing and showing off you wouldn’t have needed a warning. C’mon.” He moves his hands, sitting his butt on the table so my 5’1 frame can get a good look at his eye. It’s red, swelling, and watering.

           He smirks at me. “So, you noticed I was flexing? Did you like the view?” He wiggles his eyebrows at me, and I laugh again.

           “Oh, you think you’re smooth. You probably orchestrated all of that so you could stare into my eyes.” I say, turning to pick the ice cooler back up. About half of its left, the other half strewn across the turf and track.

           “You’ve got me figured out short stop. But I’m not hearing a no about the view.” I smirk, trying not to smile. I grab a bag and toss some ice in before sucking the air out.

           “Here, put this on your eye. It’s gonna to be black. You’ve got one hell of an arm. Let me guess, quarter back?” I guess, handing him the ice pack. He obediently places it on his left eye.

           “Most people call me Jacob Sanderson, but you’re not wrong. I am in fact the first-string quarter back.” I nod, picking the cooler up and setting it on the table. The coaches whistle, and he attempts to wink at me although with his left eye still closed all him manages is a very predominate blink in my direction. “Damn. Forget I did that, remember the awesome flexing muscles, okay short stop? I’ll be seeing ya.” I laugh again, giving him a thumbs up as he jogs away.

           “Raine!” I hear someone yell behind me, and see Peter, MJ, and Ned in the bleachers. I wave at them, looking to make sure no ones running on the track before I jog across it and climb up to where they are.

           “Hey guys, what’s up?” I ask, stealing a chip out of MJ’s bag. I crunch on it happily.

           “We decided that you taking care of dumbass football players is more interesting than Mario Cart.” Ned announces, taking a bite out of his sandwich.

           “What did Sanderson want? He try to immediately get in your pants?” MJ asks, shaking her head. “He’s so predictable. He sees pretty girl; he sleeps with pretty girl. Or at least attempts to.” The way she says it, I wonder how many times she had to turn him down.

           “Oh, they aren’t that bad. Not most of them. It’s just when they see any pair of boobs walking around, they have to flirt. It’s like they can’t help it. Doesn’t matter is she’s ugly or not. There only half-hearted attempts anyways.” I say, leaning on the railing. I hear another whistle blow, “Hey guys I gotta go, you don’t have to stay. It’s mostly boring. Bye!” I yell, then stop and turn around. “Oh, do you all want my number?” Pete stops, Ned nods enthusiastically, and MJ hands me her phone. I put my number in and then descend the steps, going back to practice.

 

Next Part: COMING SOON!

           “Hi yes, my name is Raine, I just transferred in this morning and I-“

           “The only requirements are that you have good grades, come to practice twice a week, and of course all games, here and away.” I nod, expecting no less.

           “If you want. Practice starts as soon as the school day is over.” I nod and shake her hand.

           The boy shrugs his shoulders. “I guess she’s not my type. Besides, every boy in here degrades her and the things they say about her, it’s sick.” I smile at him softly. She casts an icy gaze on the boys with her blue green eyes, kicks the marker under her desk and then pulls a new one out of her desk. I grin at her antics, knowing full well that she’s doing it on purpose.

           The bell rings, and she begins to take attendance. She gets towards the bottom of her attendance sheet when she pauses. “Elizabeth Workapick?” She calls out scanning the room. The boys in the back all make a fuss over my name. Believe me I’ve heard every play on the name Workapick.

           I stand up, and one of the boys let out a whistle. Peter turns and glares at them. “Hey baby, you come back here, sit with me and I’ll let you work this pick.” They all laugh as he motions to his groin.

           Peter almost comes out of his seat, fuming. I simply roll my eyes. “Sorry man, I don’t they’ve invented enough equipment to find your,” I motion to my groin, “try someone with microscopes for eyes.” The guys friends lose it, yelling out “OH BURN!” “MAN, SHE JUST FLAMED YOU!” among other things. I look down at Peter, who is grinning ear to ear, mouth slightly agape. They guys in the back are still yelling when I turn my attention back to the teacher. “I’m Elizabeth Workapick. But I go by middle name, Raine. I just moved hear from Tennessee.” I say, and she nods, trying not to smile at me. She marks me present, tells the boys to settle down and then begins teaching.

I take my chances on the popular kids, taking my seat.

 

           By the time my last three classes roll around I’m already tired. But as soon as I see Peter I perk back up. I see him waiting near the door for my last class, presumably to pick me up. But his eyes seemed trained on something out of my range of vision. I walk towards him looking in the direction he is. I get nearer to him when I see a pretty girl around the corner. She is pulling books out of her locker the front of the locker has magnetic letters that spell ‘Liz’ out on the front. And suddenly, what he’s staring at makes sense. I sneak up by him, whispering “Whatcha looking at Peter?” In his ear, scaring him.

           “Oh! Huh? I wasn’t staring at her-anything! I wasn’t staring at anything!” He says, all jumpy. A soft smile plays on my lips.

           “She really is pretty. Do you talk to her? Like have you tried?” I ask, falling in step with him.

           “Oh no. I think she likes Flash, they’re together a lot.” He says, shrugging. “Besides MJ was over playing it. I didn’t have a huge crush on her.”

           “Did? That’s past tense Pete.” He shrugs, his fingers looped through his backpack straps.

           “She’s pretty, but you know as time goes on, I realize being pretty doesn’t add up to everything. Personality is a lot of it. We’re here.” He says, opening the door for me.

           I nod, following him to his seat. “Here, the seat beside me is free. Ned was originally in here, but he dropped it to take Comp Shop.” Peter pats the seat next to him. I put my backpack on the floor and take my seat. Soon the teacher enters, and my mouth hangs open. I was expecting and older lady, but the woman in front of me can’t possibly be thirty yet, but she is strikingly beautiful.

           “Peter how do you not pay attention to that?” I ask, dumb founded. She flicks her blonde hair over her shoulder writing ‘Mesopotamia’ on the board.

           The boy shrugs his shoulders. “I guess she’s not my type. Besides, every boy in here degrades her and the things they say about her, it’s sick.” I smile at him softly. Almost as if to make his point, she drops her marker. She hasn’t even bent over to pick it up and the boys in the back whoop and holler at the prospect of her having to bend over. She casts an icy gaze on the boys with her blue green eyes, kicks the marker under her desk and then pulls a new one out of her desk. I grin at her antics, knowing full well that she’s doing it on purpose.

           The bell rings, and she begins to take attendance. She gets towards the bottom of her attendance sheet when she pauses. “Elizabeth Workapick?” She calls out scanning the room. The boys in the back all make a fuss over my name. Believe me I’ve heard every play on the name Workapick.

           I stand up, and one of the boys let out a whistle. Peter turns and glares at them. “Hey baby, you come back here, sit with me and I’ll let you work this pick.” They all laugh as he motions to his groin.

           Peter almost comes out of his seat, fuming. I simply roll my eyes. “Sorry man, I don’t they’ve invented enough equipment to find your,” I motion to my groin, “try someone with microscopes for eyes.” The guys friends lose it, yelling out “OH BURN!” “MAN, SHE JUST FLAMED YOU!” among other things. I look down at Peter, who is grinning ear to ear, mouth slightly agape. They guys in the back are still yelling when I turn my attention back to the teacher. “I’m Elizabeth Workapick. But I go by middle name, Raine. I just moved hear from Tennessee.” I say, and she nods, trying not to smile at me. She marks me present, tells the boys to settle down and then begins teaching.

           Soon enough I’m sitting in my last class of the day, junior English. The rest of the class is preparing their final drafts on ‘Of Mice and Men’. I sit in the corner, watching Ned and Peter type their essays, as I’ve been exempt since they’re almost done.

The final bell rings, signaling the end of the day, and I pick my backpack up, shouldering it. We meet up with MJ.

           “Hey guys.” She greets us.

           “Hey MJ.” I say, shuffling through my bag to put my schedule in there.

           “Hey Raine, do you wanna come and play Mario Cart with us at my house? We usually study after words, if Pete doesn’t ditch us.” Ned asks, taking a drink from his water bottle.

           “I wish I could but one; I’ve never played Mario Cart, and two; I have to go to football practice.” I make a face, while everyone stares at me. They continue staring so I start to wipe my face. “What? Do I have something on my face?” I ask, looking at them. But now they’re paying no attention to me, glancing at each other.

           “What do you mean you have football practice? Like you’re going go watch football practice?” MJ asks, cocking her head to the side.

           “No, I, I’m like a football nurse. It’s called football training. I go to practice and games. I’m medical team if they get hurt. And a water girl when they need it.” I explain, but they still look confused. “Okay, if you all want to see what I do you’re welcome to come watch practice or a game sometime. But I gotta go, I don’t wanna be late on my first day.” I say, waving and walking off from them. As I turn away from them, they are still standing there, looking dumbstruck.

 

           An hour later I have three crates made with ice and water, two full sized coolers with ice and water, and one mini with just ice. I load all of that, and the training bag, AED, and helmet bag into the golf cart. I get the keys from Sydney, and drive onto the field. I’ve changed out of my school clothes and into some athletic shorts, and old shirt, a hat with my hair pulled into a ponytail, and tennis shoes. I pull onto the field and start unloading, starting with the big coolers. I flex my muscles a bit as I unload them, setting the first one on the table.

           “Here let me help you with that!” I hear a male voice say from behind me. I turn to see a boy wearing the number 28 jogging towards me, his helmet in his hands. “You new?” He asks, and I nod as he unloads the second big cooler.

           “Yeah I transferred in this morning. I’m a student athletic trainer.” He nods, reaching for the smaller cooler. I watch his bicep ripple, and before I can warn him it’s not as heavy, he uses his full strength to lift it and socks himself in the eye, cooler and all. The cooler crashes to the ground as he grabs his eye.

           “Son of a bitch!” He yells, clutching his left eye. Immediately I go to his side, putting my one of my hands over his, the other on his back.

           “Hey let me see. C’mon quit hopping around like that and let me look.” I say, he stops hopping around, but is still clutching his eye. His right pierces me.

           “A warning would’ve been nice man.” I chuckle, tapping his hands still covering his eye.

           “If you hadn’t been flexing and showing off you wouldn’t have needed a warning. C’mon.” He moves his hands, sitting his butt on the table so my 5’1 frame can get a good look at his eye. It’s red, swelling, and watering.

           He smirks at me. “So, you noticed I was flexing? Did you like the view?” He wiggles his eyebrows at me, and I laugh again.

           “Oh, you think you’re smooth. You probably orchestrated all of that so you could stare into my eyes.” I say, turning to pick the ice cooler back up. About half of its left, the other half strewn across the turf and track.

           “You’ve got me figured out short stop. But I’m not hearing a no about the view.” I smirk, trying not to smile. I grab a bag and toss some ice in before sucking the air out.

           “Here, put this on your eye. It’s gonna to be black. You’ve got one hell of an arm. Let me guess, quarter back?” I guess, handing him the ice pack. He obediently places it on his left eye.

           “Most people call me Jacob Sanderson, but you’re not wrong. I am in fact the first-string quarter back.” I nod, picking the cooler up and setting it on the table. The coaches whistle, and he attempts to wink at me although with his left eye still closed all him manages is a very predominate blink in my direction. “Damn. Forget I did that, remember the awesome flexing muscles, okay short stop? I’ll be seeing ya.” I laugh again, giving him a thumbs up as he jogs away.

           “Raine!” I hear someone yell behind me, and see Peter, MJ, and Ned in the bleachers. I wave at them, looking to make sure no ones running on the track before I jog across it and climb up to where they are.

           “Hey guys, what’s up?” I ask, stealing a chip out of MJ’s bag. I crunch on it happily.

           “We decided that you taking care of dumbass football players is more interesting than Mario Cart.” Ned announces, taking a bite out of his sandwich.

           “What did Sanderson want? He try to immediately get in your pants?” MJ asks, shaking her head. “He’s so predictable. He sees pretty girl; he sleeps with pretty girl. Or at least attempts to.” The way she says it, I wonder how many times she had to turn him down.

           “Oh, they aren’t that bad. Not most of them. It’s just when they see any pair of boobs walking around, they have to flirt. It’s like they can’t help it. Doesn’t matter is she’s ugly or not. There only half-hearted attempts anyways.” I say, leaning on the railing. I hear another whistle blow, “Hey guys I gotta go, you don’t have to stay. It’s mostly boring. Bye!” I yell, then stop and turn around. “Oh, do you all want my number?” Pete stops, Ned nods enthusiastically, and MJ hands me her phone. I put my number in and then descend the steps, going back to practice.

 

Next Part: COMING SOON!

title: I Missed You
body:
WARNING!!!!! ENDGAME SPOILERS AT THE VERY END!!!


I was walking up the stairs to the flat that me and Peter had purchased together just before the snap that took him away from me. Me and Peter Parker had been dating for three years before he went to fight with the Avengers and never came back. It’s now been five years since Peter vanished and I still haven’t moved any of his stuff.

When I stepped into the flat, I heard an incredibly familiar voice calling out my name from the living room. I made my way over to the doorway and stopped when I saw the back of Peter’s head. My gasp caused him to turn around and that’s when our eyes met for the first time in five years.

‘Is – is – is it really you?’ I whisper, terrified that this was all just some kind of cruel trick that my mind was playing on me.

Peter nodded slightly before walking over to me, holding my face in his hands and crashing his lips onto mine.

‘It’s me,’ he whispered after breaking the kiss.

‘How are you here right now?’ I asked, placing my hands on his shoulders and gripping them tight, making sure that he was real.

‘It’s a long story and I promise I’ll tell you all of it but I really need you at the moment,’ he said, breathing heavily into my mouth as he reconnected our lips, ‘can I?’

All I could do was nod as he picked me up and took me into our bedroom. He gently laid me on the bed and began to kiss his way down my body, undressing me as he went.

When he had completely undressed me, he sat back and got rid of his spider suit before staring at me.

‘What?’ I asked, moving my arms to cover my breasts.

‘Don’t,’ he said, reaching out to grip my wrist, ‘I’ve missed you so much,’ he said, crawling up my body and connecting our lips once more as he pushed into me. After giving us both a moment to adjust, Peter started up a pace that was slow but hit all of the right spots inside of me; we were a perfect match.

‘Peter, please,’ I begged as he began to speed up slightly.

‘I know, baby, I love you so much,’ Peter replied as I came around his cock and he came inside me.

After we had both cleaned up, we were laying in our bed underneath a blanket, my head resting on Peter’s chest and his arms wrapped around me.

‘I’ve missed this,’ he murmured as I nuzzled into his chest.

‘Me too,’ I said softly. It was silent for a while before I heard a sniff and I looked up to see Peter silently crying and my heart instantly broke at the sight.

‘What’s wrong my love?’ I asked, wiping his tears away.

‘He’s gone (Y/N). Tony. Mr Stark. He died right in front of me.’ Peter said, still crying as I felt my own tears well up in my eyes.

All I did was kiss the tears away and pulled him closer to me as we both fell into a deep sleep, finally in each other’s arms again.

summary: blurb night? skipping school with peter parker and getting coffee cause he misses tony (and tony likes coffee)
question: blurb night? skipping school with peter parker and getting coffee cause he misses tony (and tony likes coffee)
answer:
Blurb night, my dude!!


Besides Peter’s Spider-Man duties neither of you were the type to do this. He never would have normally asked this, and you wouldn’t have agreed to go.

However, something about today had Peter feeling worse than normal. Well, since the final battle with Those and Tony’ s funeral there was nothing really for him but “worse” and “feeling bad” …but today, the “ worse” and “bad” was hitting him harder then it had since the day he woke up in a post-ironman world.

It had taken him glancing at the calendar to figure out why. 

One year…

it was one year since the world lost it’s hero, and best avenger. 

The realization made tears prick at peter’s eyes and he felt like just crawling into bed and letting the tears out. but he knew May would just drag him out if he didn’t and honestly, he knew the best  thing for him wasn’t around here.

He needed you, so peter got dressed and caught the train on schedule, walking up to your locker as soon as he arrived in the building. 

You heard him coming up and turned to greet him with a smile only to have both your expression and words falling to the abyss once you saw his face. 

“Peter, what’s wrong?” you wanted to give him a hug, but hesitated till he walked right into you and wrapped his arms around you.

“Everything.” the sniffled word was muffled and garbled by your shirt, but  you spoke fluent peter so you understood him.

“Oh, pete.” 

you ran your hair through his thick curls, feeling him hum at the action till he pull back enough to look at you, puppy dog eyes at full weaponized capacity

“I-I just need a break today. do you think we could skip school go get a drink and talk? please?”

You were powerless against so formidable an attack as those deep chocolate eyes and caved instantly 

“Of course peter, whatever you need.”

  Blurb night

“Everything.” the sniffled word was muffled and garbled by your shirt, but  you spoke fluent peter so you understood him.

“Oh, pete.” 

you ran your hair through his thick curls, feeling him hum at the action till he pull back enough to look at you, puppy dog eyes at full weaponized capacity

“I-I just need a break today. do you think we could skip school go get a drink and talk? please?”

You were powerless against so formidable an attack as those deep chocolate eyes and caved instantly 

“Of course peter, whatever you need.”

  Blurb night
trail.content:
Blurb night, my dude!!


Besides Peter’s Spider-Man duties neither of you were the type to do this. He never would have normally asked this, and you wouldn’t have agreed to go.

However, something about today had Peter feeling worse than normal. Well, since the final battle with Those and Tony’ s funeral there was nothing really for him but “worse” and “feeling bad” …but today, the “ worse” and “bad” was hitting him harder then it had since the day he woke up in a post-ironman world.

It had taken him glancing at the calendar to figure out why. 

One year…

it was one year since the world lost it’s hero, and best avenger. 

The realization made tears prick at peter’s eyes and he felt like just crawling into bed and letting the tears out. but he knew May would just drag him out if he didn’t and honestly, he knew the best  thing for him wasn’t around here.

He needed you, so peter got dressed and caught the train on schedule, walking up to your locker as soon as he arrived in the building. 

You heard him coming up and turned to greet him with a smile only to have both your expression and words falling to the abyss once you saw his face.

title: Can’t We Be Seventeen?
body:
Peter Parker x Reader | Angst to Fluff Blurb

Request: Can you do a peter parker x reader fic based on the song Seventeen from The Heathers Musical, kinda like taking place all THAT Endgame stuff. Where the reader is just helping our lil pete through everything🥺 super fluff:))

Summary: The reader helps Peter move on since the events of Endgame, convincing him to go on the class trip. 

Word Count: 606

It had been a few weeks since the vanished came back to the world, readjusting to normalcy was finally becoming easier. Except or Peter who continued to lock himself in his bedroom alone. His loud sobs turned into muffled cried in his pillows, Aunt May and his beloved Y/N stood at his doorframe, sympathetically looking at the ground. 

“I’m so worried,” Aunt May confessions on the brink of tears. Y/N holds her hand and leans against her. She only once dared to talk to him about moving on, carrying on being Spider-Man…and being a teenager for once. She was met with yelling and violent throwing of his belongings in his room. She didn’t dare to bring it up again, she knew he needed more time but everyone was getting worried. 

“I’m going in,” she sighs, pulling away from May. The older woman nods and wishes her luck as she takes a step back. Y/N pushes open the dark wood door and sees the love of her life on his bed with his knees pressed against his chest with his head against them. 

“Pete,” she whispers as her heart breaks seeing him this way. She climbs on the bed behind him, wrapping his broken frame in her arms. He places one hand over hers and leans into her embrace. “You can’t keep doing this.” 

“It’s all my fault… I-I’m a superhero. N-none of this was supposed to happen. He should be here!” he sobs. All she could do was hold him tighter, closer to her to comfort him. 

“You’re still seventeen, Peter. Can’t we be seventeen?” 

“What?” he asks slowly. 

“Tony would want you to be seventeen. Live your life…with me,” her words come out hesitant, afraid of an outburst like the last time.  The brunette stays silent for a moment, he sniffs and dries his eyes on his pants. “Do you want to be with me?” 

The words make Peter quickly turn around to hug you tightly “I lost Tony I can’t lose you too,” he cries. “I want you, Y/N. I need you.” Y/N holds onto him tightly, burying her face in the crook of his neck. 

“Let’s go out, be normal.” 

“I don’t know how to be normal anymore. I don’t feel seventeen.” She pulls back and places her hand on the side of his face, wiping away a few tears that escaped his dark eyes.

“Let’s go see a movie? Get pizza at the place we like down the street,” she offers simple things. He finally nods and looks at you with the softest smile you’d ever seen. “Maybe we could go to prom, like normal seniors?” 

Peter starts to laugh as you mention prom but that joy turns back into the bleak sadness “I had this big promposal planned before the snap… I’m so sorry.” She hugs him again before he could breakdown again. 

Y/N finally manages to get him out of bed, wobbly but he gets there. He’d eaten barely anything in days, that pizza she mentioned sounded really good “You don’t have to apologize Peter. At all,” she responds sternly. Peter holds her hand as they stand in the center of the room, his thumb gently rubbing over her knuckles. 

“I want to be seventeen,” he whispers, “I want to be with you.” 

Y/N stands on her tippy toes and kisses him gently “Will you go on the school trip with me? I need my Spider-Man in Europe. I need Peter Parker, the love of my life by my side.” The boy nods and kisses her again, pulling her close. 

“I’ll go. It’s what Tony would’ve wanted,” he finally agrees, resting his forehead against hers. She smiles at his response and nods against him, holding onto his hand tighter.
